channel.description:
[b]Push_Spy04_Kleiner[/size][/b] [b][/size][/b][img]blob:https://imgur.com/a2403a0f-1329-499e-add9-79c50e036bc1[/img][img]https://i.imgur.com/qA0dM77.jpg[/img]
A while back someone asked if someone could create a payload / push map for Black Mesa. Sunday to Monday I had trouble sleeping and came up with an idea for a map. So I converted one of my spy maps into a working payload map for Black Mesa.
Marines have to push the hovering fridge bomb through the facility all while the scientists try their best to stop them. The bomb starts moving when a marine is in the zone around it and will stop when nobody is around it.
Spawn points will be enabled and disabled throughout the map as the bomb is pushed. The spawn points comes with different guns according to what stage of the map you're in, beginning with weaker weapons and then moving the heavier weaponary.
If the marines successfully push the bomb to the end they will win, should the scientist prevent the marines from pushing the bomb they will instead win. The map should be played with teams enabled.
Fraglimit has been changed so you can't win the map with frags alone, you have to keep the bomb moving (or not, if you're a scientist). Map should be playable with all player numbers, but the more the merrier.

item.title: [Multiplayer] push_spy04_kleiner
item.dc:creator: LordDz
item.description:
Thanks for the feedback.
Yeah I will make some physics object into debris or remove them.
I’ll add some lighting too.

Players in multiplayer can’t pickup anything, so can’t do anything with that. The scientists do have some satchel and tripmines scattered around the map that they can place however.

I probably could add a health dispenser, but most of the spawns are relatively close to the cart and most playerspawns come with a varied weaponary so sometimes the marines are going to have better weaponary.
Also I reduced the spawning time to 5 seconds instead of the usual 10, so will have to playtest a bit to see how it works out.

Some rooms are too dark where objects are completely black and it is quite hard to see anything in there. It could use some small lights or at least red emergency lightning.

It would be fun if scientists could pick up and move those explosive barrels to make some traps

Is it possible in map to place health dispenser function into bomb? Because defending scientists probably have tactical advantage + access to better weaponry.
